cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 355 miles SE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest tonight, then turning northwest and north toward the South Carolina coast; expected to drift inland across eastern South Carolina and southeastern North Carolina before curving back offshore north of Cape Lookout
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Charleston–Beaufort, South Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect at Wilmington; watches begin farther south of Savannah River, SC–GA line
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River to Little River Inlet, South Carolina
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central South Carolina through southeastern and eastern North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds could reach tropical-storm force (35–45 mph); 27 % chance of sustained gale-force winds at the port over the next five days.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation of 1–2 ft above ground level possible along the immediate beaches; significant surge above 3 ft not expected at Wilmington.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible as the depression moves nearby Monday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along area beaches beginning this weekend.
